instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad cap?
threads.message:
Hi Team,
I have another <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board which had liquid damage around the SMC area, I've already passed it in the UC
I've noticed that the Fan only spin when i,m heating the <CAPACITOR>C7515</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C7516</CAPACITOR>, and <CAPACITOR>C7529</CAPACITOR> area.
That remembers me a Louis video , where it was a bad cap  the issue as its value was changing because of the heat.
Of course it could anywhere around there maybe on the other side of the board as well.....
When the fan spins i have no chime and the cpu is getting hot.
will check all rails and post again, in the mean time any advice is welcome.

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bad cap?
threads.message: Crap under the SMC is more likely. Flux and reflow or reball.
